report_id.description: Unique ID (renamed from post_id for clarity)

title.description: Report title, what you would see as the top heading or browse hyperlink.

publish_date.description: ISO 8601 timestamps used for all dates in this template.

mission_name.description: Format can be specific to habitat or crew increment

mission_type.description: Should be defined in the future

mission_start_date.description: Start of the mission or crew increment. Can be used with the next field to calculate which date this report covers.

mission_duration_day.description: Integer days of the mission or crew increment. For Mars Analogs, this is the same as 'Sol #'

report_date.description: Specific date this report was covering. Should be same as the above date (Start of mission + sol #).

report_type.description: e.g., Commander's Report, EVA Report, End-of-Mission Report, etc.

crew_members.description: Optional; Array of crew members and roles. Not necessary for every report. Suitable for crew bios, initial plan, or final mission summary report.

content.description: Main Content of Report; free-form formatted text (e.g., Markdown or lightweight HTML)

resource_usage.description: Optional; Common in analogs for sustainability tracking

environmental_data.description: Optional; e.g., weather, radiation (varies by station)

incidents.description: Optional; used to classify a reported incident. Other current station procedures should also be followed when reporting an incident.

medical_notes.description: Optional; String, can be anything. Be careful to maintain privacy of crewmembers.

health_and_safety.description: Optional; can be used for Health & Safety Report.

metadata.description: Extensible for custom data. Further procedures should be established for use.
